title: Cognitive Load Measurement and Optimization in VR Simulation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in VR device operation and foundational health-related knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners participate in VR simulations via personal mobile devices; cognitive load is analyzed through real-time eye-tracking technology. The training gradually increases task difficulty in health management scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can measure cognitive load changes based on task difficulty in VR simulation environments using TEPRs (pupillary light reflex-corrected values).
Learners can develop the ability to analyze training effectiveness by comparing measured cognitive load data with self-assessment results.
Learners can understand the correlation between performance measurement and cognitive load in VR-based training and adjust training strategies accordingly.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
